column12: WATER-ABSORBING POLYMER PARTICLES HAVING A HIGH SWELLING RATE AND HIGH PERMEABILITY
column13: The invention relates to a method for producing water-absorbing polymer particles having a high swelling rate and high permeability by polymerizing an aqueous monomer solution or monomer suspension to form an aqueous polymer gel, wherein a thermal blowing agent, which is substantially free of inorganic acid anions, is mixed into the polymer gel, and subsequently thermally drying the polymer gel.
column15: WEISMANTEL MATTHIAS;;RIEGEL ULRICH;;GIEGER THOMAS;;BRAUN MARKUS;;MITCHELL MICHAEL
column32: F.L. BUCHHOLZ; A.T. GRAHAM: "Modern Superabsorbent Polymer Technology", 1998, WILEY-VCH, pages: 71 - 103;;See also references of EP 2814854A1
